item.title: Hong Kong’s green tech hub goal: nurture start-ups, identify advantages and create talent pool, fintech body says
item.description:
English Summary：

  • Hong Kong aims to be a hub for green tech and green finance, leveraging China's strengths in sectors like electric vehicles and renewable energy.
  • The government and private sector should collaborate to create funding for green start-ups, attract and develop talent, and cultivate a risk-taking mindset.
  • Identifying sub-sectors where Hong Kong has advantages, such as low-carbon energy, greenhouse gas emissions, and climate risk data analysis, is crucial.
  • Expanding financial assistance programs to encourage family offices and institutional investors to participate in start-up fundraising is important.
  • Government initiatives, such as research and development funding schemes and green technology funds, are instrumental in supporting green tech innovation.
  • Addressing talent pool growth, retention, and acquisition, as well as fostering a risk-taking mindset, are ongoing challenges for Hong Kong's green tech ambitions.

中文总结：

  • 香港致力于成为绿色科技和绿色金融的枢纽，利用了中国在电动汽车和可再生能源等领域的优势。
  • 政府和私营部门应携手合作，为绿色初创企业提供资金，吸引和培养人才，并培养冒险精神。
  • 寻找香港具有优势的子行业，如低碳能源、温室气体排放和气候风险数据分析，至关重要。
  • 扩大金融援助计划以鼓励家族办公室和机构投资者参与初创企业的募资活动非常重要。
  • 政府倡议，如研发资金计划和绿色技术基金，对于支持绿色技术创新发挥着重要作用。
  • 解决人才库的增长、保留和获取，以及培养冒险精神，是香港绿色科技雄心的持续挑战。

单词：

  • leverage (v.) - /ˈlɛvərɪdʒ/ 利用（杠杆作用）、利用（优势）。

    原文例句：Hong Kong’s aim of becoming a green technology and finance centre can become a reality if efforts are concentrated on supporting start-ups and leveraging China’s expertise in crucial technologies.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于法语lever，表示“利用杠杆作用，利用优势”。在这个例句中，它描述了香港城市如何利用中国在关键技术方面的专业知识来实现成为绿色技术和金融中心的目标。

  • crucial (adj.) - /ˈkruːʃəl/ 关键的，重要的。

    原文例句：The government and the private sector should step up collaboration to create funding structures to back green start-ups, attract and nurture a talent pool and foster a risk-taking mindset, said Sandeep Sethi, co-chair of the non-profit’s green tech and ESG committee.

    例句讲解：这个词源自拉丁语crux，意为“十字架”。在这个例句中，它指的是非常重要或决定性的因素。

  • sub-sector (n.) - /ˌsʌbˈsɛktə/ 子行业，次级行业。

    原文例句：“We need to identify sub-sectors where we feel Hong Kong has certain advantages.”

    例句讲解：这个词由sub（低于）和sector（部门，行业）组成。在这个例句中，它指的是经济中的一个较小行业或部门。

词组：

  • green tech - 绿色科技。

    原文例句：Hong Kong’s aim of becoming a green technology and finance centre can become a reality if efforts are concentrated on supporting start-ups and leveraging China’s expertise in crucial technologies.

    单词讲解：绿色科技是指利用技术手段减少环境影响、保护生态环境的技术。在这个例句中，它描述了香港的绿色科技产业发展方向。

  • green finance - 绿色金融。

    原文例句：Hong Kong’s aim of becoming a green technology and finance centre can become a reality if efforts are concentrated on supporting start-ups and leveraging China’s expertise in crucial technologies.

    单词讲解：绿色金融是指将环境因素纳入金融决策，支持环境可持续发展和绿色经济发展的金融活动。在这个例句中，它描述了香港的绿色金融产业发展方向。

句子：

  • Hong Kong’s ambition to become an international centre for both green tech and green finance was highlighted by Financial Secretary Paul Chan Mo-po in his budget speech last February. - 香港金融秘书陈茂波在去年的预算演讲中强调了香港成为国际绿色科技和绿色金融中心的愿景。

    句子分析：这个句子是一个复合句，主句是Hong Kong’s ambition to become an international centre for both green tech and green finance was highlighted，其中主语是Hong Kong’s ambition，谓语是was highlighted。Financial Secretary Paul Chan Mo-po in his budget speech last February是一个介词短语作状语，修饰谓语was highlighted，表示这一愿景是在去年2月的预算演讲中被强调的。这个句子的意思是说，香港将成为国际绿色科技和绿色金融中心的愿景在去年2月的预算演讲中被强调了。

语法：

  • 名词性从句 - 由that或wh-词引导，在句中充当名词。

    原文例句：The government and the private sector should step up collaboration to create funding structures to back green start-ups, attract and nurture a talent pool and foster a risk-taking mindset, said Sandeep Sethi, co-chair of the non-profit’s green tech and ESG committee.

    语法讲解：在这个句子中，The government and the private sector should step up collaboration to create funding structures to back green start-ups, attract and nurture a talent pool and foster a risk-taking mindset是一个名词性从句，充当said的宾语。它描述了政府和私营部门应该采取的具体行动，包括创造资助结构来支持绿色初创企业，吸引和培养人才库，以及培养冒险精神。

  • Public-private collaboration to fund start-ups, attracting and nurturing talent can help city achieve green tech, finance hub goal: FinTech Association of Hong Kong
  • City must leverage China’s dominance in fields such as electric vehicles and renewable energy to its advantage, non-profit’s Sandeep Sethi says

Hong Kong’s aim of becoming a green technology and finance centre can become a reality if efforts are concentrated on supporting start-ups and leveraging China’s expertise in crucial technologies, according to the FinTech Association of Hong Kong.

The government and the private sector should step up collaboration to create funding structures to back green start-ups, attract and nurture a talent pool and foster a risk-taking mindset, said Sandeep Sethi, co-chair of the non-profit’s green tech and ESG committee.

“Various cities are trying to promote themselves as green tech centres” said Sethi, who is also an independent consultant and a former executive at Deutsche Bank. “We feel it is important for Hong Kong to put that flag up and say we are the leading green tech centre. We need to identify sub-sectors where we feel Hong Kong has certain advantages.”

Given China’s leadership position in electric vehicles, renewable energy and hydrogen, these sectors can be initial targets for collaborations, he added.

Hong Kong’s ambition to become an international centre for both green tech and green finance was highlighted by Financial Secretary Paul Chan Mo-po in his budget speech last February. Previously, the focus was on building the city into a leading green and sustainable finance hub in Asia.

The government followed up its intention by setting up a green technology and finance development committee, comprising leaders from the finance, technology, academic and professional services sectors in June.

Next month, the government is hosting the Hong Kong GreenTech Week, which aims to bring together green tech businesses and investors from around the world, according to co-organiser Green Development Institute.

On a more basic level, Hong Kong can do better by providing early-stage funding for start-ups involved in areas such as low-carbon energy products, greenhouse gas emissions and tools for collecting and analysing data on physical climate risks, said Chris Barford, a director of the FinTech Association of Hong Kong.

“Some green tech start-ups that have done well after getting seed funding of HK$10 million (US$1.3 million) to HK$20 million have struggled to raise additional financing to fund expansion,” said Barford, who is also the Hong Kong financial services consulting data and analytics lead at consultancy EY.

The government should consider expanding its financial assistance programmes, which would encourage family offices and institutional investors to take part in fundraising by start-ups, he added.

Towards that end the Hong Kong government is providing assistance. The different research and development funding schemes overseen by the Innovation and Technology Commission had provided total funding of some HK$400 million to about 130 green tech R&D projects as of last June, according to the Environment and Ecology Bureau.

The bureau also administers a HK$400 million Green Tech Fund that supports R&D projects in net-zero electricity generation, energy savings, green buildings, green transport and waste reduction. Some 30 projects have received HK$132.5 million since the fund was set up in 2020.

The government’s Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks Corporation and Cyberport have also set up separate funds to co-invest with angel investors and venture capital funds in start-ups at their respective industry parks.

Hong Kong regains appeal among global talent amid demand in fintech, ESG

“There is a gap between the intention and the actual projects that get financed,” said Sethi. “A lot of these are new technology projects where it is hard to prove the business case and profitability. This is where public-private collaborative funding can help.”

Other difficulties facing the government and industries include growing the talent pool, Sethi said.

Some 80 per cent of senior finance executives in the city, surveyed late last year by the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, said recruiting green and sustainable finance professionals was more difficult compared with other job functions. Talent retention and acquisition was the second most pressing issue after disclosure regulations.

Fostering a risk-taking mindset is another challenge, according to Sethi.

“In a lot of Asian countries, the education systems are focused on preparing students to get stable jobs, but in tech we need entrepreneurs who are willing to take risks,” he said. “It takes years and perhaps generations to change the mindset.”

item.title: Apple’s Vision Pro headset will be missing a Netflix app at launch in February
item.description:
Summary：

Netflix will not be developing an app for Apple's upcoming Vision Pro headset, despite it being a major player in the streaming industry. Instead, users will have to watch Netflix content on the Vision Pro through a web browser, without the ability to download content for offline viewing or access custom environments. This decision suggests that Netflix is taking a cautious approach to the Vision Pro, potentially due to its rivalry with Apple in the streaming market.
  • Abstract: Netflix's decision not to develop an app for Apple's Vision Pro headset.
  • Theme: The dynamics of competition and collaboration between streaming giants Netflix and Apple.
  • Viewpoint: Netflix's cautious approach to the Vision Pro may stem from its rivalry with Apple in the streaming industry.
  • Main information: Netflix users will access content on the Vision Pro through a web browser; no offline viewing or custom environments; Netflix's decision may be influenced by competition with Apple.

总结：

Netflix宣布不会为苹果即将推出的Vision Pro头显开发应用程序，尽管它在流媒体行业中扮演着重要角色。相反，用户将需要通过网络浏览器在Vision Pro上观看Netflix内容，而无法下载内容以供离线观看或访问自定义环境。这一决定表明，Netflix对Vision Pro采取了谨慎的态度，这可能是由于它在流媒体市场上与苹果存在竞争关系。
  • 摘要：Netflix决定不为苹果的Vision Pro头显开发应用程序。
  • 主题：流媒体巨头Netflix和Apple在竞争与合作之间的微妙关系。
  • 观点：Netflix对Vision Pro的谨慎态度可能源于它在流媒体行业与苹果的竞争关系。
  • 主要信息：Netflix用户将通过网络浏览器访问Vision Pro上的内容；没有离线观看或自定义环境；Netflix的决定可能受到与苹果的竞争影响。

单词：

  • headset (n.) - /ˈhedˌset/ 耳机，头戴式耳机。

    原文例句：The Apple Vision Pro headset seen at an unveiling event in Cupertino, California last June.

    例句讲解：这个单词是由head（头部）和set（设置）构成的，表示“一种戴在头上的设备，通常用于听音乐或打电话”。在这个例句中，它指的是去年6月在加州库比蒂诺举行的发布会上展示的苹果Vision Pro头显。

  • subscription (n.) - /səbˈskrɪpʃən/ 订阅，订购。

    原文例句：Netflix is the world’s biggest video subscription service.

    例句讲解：这个单词是由sub-（在……之下）和scribe（写）构成的，表示“一种定期支付费用以获得某项服务或产品的权利”。在这个例句中，它指的是Netflix作为世界上最大的视频订阅服务。

  • nascent (adj.) - /ˈneɪsnt/ 新生的，初生的。

    原文例句：Apple is banking on entertainment content to help market the nascent and pricey technology.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由nasci（出生）构成，表示“新生的，初生的”。在这个例句中，它描述了苹果公司押注于娱乐内容来帮助营销这项新兴且昂贵的技术。

词组：

  • take a pass - 放弃，不参与。

    原文例句：Rather than designing a Vision Pro app – or even just supporting its existing iPad app on the platform – Netflix is essentially taking a pass.

    例句讲解：这个词组由take和pass组成，表示“放弃，不参与”。在这个例句中，它描述了Netflix公司基本上放弃了为Vision Pro设计应用程序，甚至只是支持其现有的iPad应用程序。

  • make it easy to - 使……变得容易。

    原文例句：Apple has sought to make it easy to transfer developers’ current iPad apps over to the new platform.

    例句讲解：这个词组由make和it easy to组成，表示“使……变得容易”。在这个例句中，它描述了苹果公司努力使开发人员能够轻松地将他们当前的iPad应用程序转移到新平台上。

  • on the platform - 在平台上。

    原文例句：Rather than designing a Vision Pro app – or even just supporting its existing iPad app on the platform – Netflix is essentially taking a pass.

    例句讲解：这个词组由on和platform组成，表示“在平台上”。在这个例句中，它描述了Netflix公司基本上放弃了为Vision Pro设计应用程序，甚至只是支持其现有的iPad应用程序。

句子：

  • In contrast with its Vision Pro strategy, Netflix did develop an app for Meta Platforms’ Quest headsets, though it has not been updated in years. - 相比之下，Netflix为Meta Platforms的Quest头显开发了一款应用程序，尽管它已经好几年没有更新了。

    句子分析：这是一个复杂句，主句是Netflix did develop an app，其中主语是Netflix，谓语是did develop，宾语是an app。In contrast with its Vision Pro strategy是一个介词短语作状语，表示与Vision Pro战略形成对比。though it has not been updated in years是一个现在完成时分词短语作状语，表示尽管它已经好几年没有更新了。这个句子的意思是说，相比之下，Netflix为Meta Platforms的Quest头显开发了一款应用程序，尽管它已经好几年没有更新了。

语法：

  • 过去分词作状语 - 表示动作或状态发生在主句动作或状态之前。

    原文例句：The company, which competes with Apple in streaming, said in a statement that users interested in watching its content on the device can do so from the web.

    语法讲解：这是一个常见的句型，表示动作或状态发生在主句动作或状态之前。结构是：过去分词+主句。其中过去分词是动词的过去分词形式。在这个例句中，过去分词是competes，表示竞争，作状语，表示这句话发生在这个动作或状态之前。这个句子的意思是说，这家与苹果在流媒体领域竞争的公司在一份声明中表示，有兴趣在设备上观看其内容的用户可以通过网络观看。

  • Rather than designing a Vision Pro app or supporting its existing iPad app on the platform, Netflix says users can watch its content on a web browser
  • The approach means Vision Pro users will not be able to download Netflix content to watch offline on an aeroplane

Netflix is not planning to launch an app for Apple’s upcoming Vision Pro headset, marking a high-profile snub of the new technology by the world’s biggest video subscription service.

Rather than designing a Vision Pro app – or even just supporting its existing iPad app on the platform – Netflix is essentially taking a pass. The company, which competes with Apple in streaming, said in a statement that users interested in watching its content on the device can do so from the web.

It is a sizeable omission for the US$3,499 headset, which debuts on February 2. Apple is banking on entertainment content to help market the nascent and pricey technology, and Netflix is a must-have streaming service for many consumers.

Netflix also offers apps for Apple’s other devices, including the iPhone and iPad, though it does not participate in the company’s TV app.

The Vision Pro will run two main types of apps: new software written specifically for the device’s interface or existing iPad applications. Apple has sought to make it easy to transfer developers’ current iPad apps over to the new platform, aiming to quickly amass a wide range of Vision Pro software.

The fact that Netflix is not even willing to support the iPad approach suggests that it is taking a wait-and-see stance with the headset. It is also a bit of a reversal for the company, which said in July that it would support its iPad app on the Vision Pro. Even then, though, Netflix did not plan to release software specifically for the headset’s operating system, visionOS.

“Our members will be able to enjoy Netflix on the web browser on the Vision Pro, similar to how our members can enjoy Netflix on Macs,” Los Gatos, California-based Netflix said in the statement. Apple declined to comment.

In contrast with its Vision Pro strategy, Netflix did develop an app for Meta Platforms’ Quest headsets, though it has not been updated in years.

The approach means it will be harder for users to access Netflix on the Vision Pro. And they will not be able to download Netflix content to watch offline, potentially making it more of a pain to use on an aeroplane.

The lack of an app also means Netflix watchers will not have access to custom environments for streaming. That means Netflix cannot create specialised immersive backdrops for its users to watch videos in.

While Netflix and Apple do not compete in TV hardware, they are both currently vying for subscribers in the streaming industry.

Apple is a small player in this category, with less than 10 per cent of the US market. But it has been gathering award wins in the space, and the two companies compete over talent and production deals. It is plausible Netflix does not want to help boost a rival by giving it a key app for its upcoming launch.

Apple has been marketing the Vision Pro as an entertainment device in the run-up to pre-orders beginning on Friday.

The Cupertino, California-based company said earlier this week that the headset would have many entertainment options beyond its own TV+ service. That includes programming from Disney+, Max, Peacock, ESPN and Amazon Prime Video, among others.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S24 series smartphones come with Google Gemini AI technology to fight Apple iPhones
item.description:
Summary：

Samsung's latest Galaxy S24, S24+ and S24 Ultra smartphones boasts several new AI-related features, including the ability to live-translate phone calls, transcribe voice recordings, summarize web articles and fix handwritten notes. These features are powered by Google's Gemini AI technology and aim to enhance the user experience and provide a competitive edge over Apple's iPhone.
  • Abstract: Samsung unveiled its new Galaxy S24 series, incorporating advanced AI features powered by Google's Gemini technology.
  • Theme: Samsung's focus on AI integration to differentiate its smartphones from competitors, particularly Apple, and regain market share.
  • Viewpoint: The role of AI features in enhancing the user experience and driving Samsung's competitiveness in the smartphone market.
  • Main information: Live-translation, transcription, summarization, and handwriting correction capabilities; partnership with Google for exclusive access to generative AI features; the inclusion of AI in camera systems and Android Auto integration.

总结：

三星最新的Galaxy S24、S24+和S24 Ultra智能手机拥有多项新的人工智能相关功能，包括实时翻译电话、转录语音录音、总结网络文章以及修复手写笔记。这些功能由谷歌的双子星人工智能技术提供支持，旨在增强用户体验，并在与苹果iPhone的竞争中获取优势。
  • 摘要：三星发布了其新的Galaxy S24系列，融入了由谷歌的双子星技术支持的先进的人工智能功能。
  • 主题：三星专注于人工智能整合以使其智能手机在与竞争对手（尤其是苹果）的区别，并重新获得市场份额。
  • 观点：人工智能功能在增强用户体验和推动三星在智能手机市场竞争力方面的作用。
  • 主要信息：实时翻译、转录、总结和手写修正功能；与谷歌合作以独家访问生成式人工智能功能；人工智能被纳入相机系统和Android Auto集成。

单词：

  • unveil (v.) - /ʌnˈveɪl/ 揭幕，公布。

    原文例句：At its Unpacked conference Wednesday in San Jose, California，Samsung unveiled the Galaxy S24, S24+ and S24 Ultra phones.

    例句讲解：这个词来源于拉丁语velum（面纱），意为“揭开面纱”，表示“揭幕，公布”。在这个例句中，它说明三星在加州圣何塞的Unpacked发布会上推出了Galaxy S24、S24+和S24 Ultra手机.

  • weave (v.) - /wiːv/ 编织，交织。

    原文例句：The launch is one of the most ambitious attempts to weave AI into a smartphone’s interface and features.

    例句讲解：这个词来源于古英语wifan，意为“编织”，表示“编织，交织”。在这个例句中，它说明这次发布是将人工智能融入智能手机界面和功能的最具野心的尝试之一.

词组：

  • look to - 希望，指望。

    原文例句：Samsung looks to reverse its fortunes by getting a several-month head start on AI.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由look（看）和to（向）组成的，表示“希望，指望”。在这个例句中，它表示三星希望通过在人工智能方面领先几个月来扭转其命运.

  • be based on - 根据，依据。

    原文例句：The S24 line-up will be based on its Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 applications processor, the company said in a separate statement.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由be（是）和based on（根据）组成的，表示“根据，依据”。在这个例句中，它表示S24系列将基于其骁龙8 Gen 3应用程序处理器.

句子：

  • Qualcomm is providing the main chip of the new Samsung phones in at least some regions. - 高通公司至少在某些地区提供新款三星手机的主要芯片。

    句子分析：这是一个简单句，主语是Qualcomm，谓语是is providing，宾语是the main chip of the new Samsung phones，状语是in at least some regions。这个句子的意思是说，高通公司为至少部分地区的新款三星手机提供主要芯片.

  • Samsung’s phone shipments declined nearly 14 per cent to 226.6 million units in 2023, according to research firm IDC. - 根据研究公司IDC的数据，三星手机发货量在2023年下降近14%，至2.266亿部。

    句子分析：这是一个复杂句，主句是三星手机发货量在2023年下降近14%，从句是根据研究公司IDC的数据。主语是Samsung’s phone shipments，谓语是declined，宾语是nearly 14 per cent to 226.6 million units，状语是in 2023。从句的主语是research firm IDC，谓语是said，宾语是三星手机发货量在2023年下降近14%，状语是according to。这个句子的意思是说，根据研究公司IDC的数据，三星手机发货量在2023年下降近14%，至2.266亿部.

语法：

  • 比较级 - 表示比较。

    原文例句：The borders around the displays are 42 per cent thinner.

    语法讲解：在英语语法中，比较级是形容词或副词的一种形式，用于比较两个或多个事物或概念。比较级的构成是：形容词或副词的原级+er，或者在形容词或副词前加more。在这个例句中，thinner是thin的比较级，表示“更薄”。这个句子的意思是说，显示屏周围的边框薄了42%。

  • 虚拟语气 - 表示假设、愿望或可能性。

    原文例句：This flexibility helped Google’s offerings stand out from the competition, Kurian said.

    语法讲解：在英语语法中，虚拟语气是一种语态，用于表达假设、愿望或可能性。虚拟语气的构成是：would/could/should/might + 动词原形。在这个例句中，stand out是虚拟语气的动词，表示“脱颖而出”。Kurian说，这种灵活性帮助谷歌的产品在竞争中脱颖而出。这个句子的意思是说，Kurian说，这种灵活性帮助谷歌的产品在竞争中脱颖而出.

  • The Galaxy S24, S24+ and S24 Ultra can live-translate phone calls, transcribe voice recordings, summarise web articles and fix handwriting
  • Apple is not expected to showcase its latest plans for artificial intelligence until June, ahead of new iPhones arriving around September

Samsung Electronics is turning to artificial intelligence (AI) features to revamp its flagship Galaxy smartphones, betting that the technology can give it an advantage over Apple’s iPhone.

At its Unpacked conference Wednesday in San Jose, California, Samsung unveiled the Galaxy S24, S24+ and S24 Ultra phones, which all add AI tools based on the Gemini technology from Alphabet’s Google.

The devices can live-translate phone calls, transcribe voice recordings, summarise web articles, fix handwriting and use generative AI to fill in parts of photos.

The launch is one of the most ambitious attempts to weave AI into a smartphone’s interface and features. The new devices also provide Google with a chance to put its most advanced software in the hands of more users, a potential edge in its fight for AI dominance with Microsoft and start-up OpenAI.

The AI features are the highlight of the new phones, but the devices are also getting slimmer bezels and brighter displays. Samsung is paying special attention to its top-end model, the S24 Ultra. That product, which starts at US$1,299, will have a new titanium frame, matching the iPhone 15 Pro models released in September.

The borders around the displays are 42 per cent thinner, and the screen is 40 per cent brighter than the phone’s predecessor. It also sports flatter edges and a front-facing camera cut-out that is 11 per cent smaller.

The US$799 S24 and US$999 S24+ come in aluminium and get slightly larger screens than their predecessors, moving from 6.1-inch and 6.6-inch panels to 6.2-inch and 6.7-inch displays, respectively. The S24 Ultra, like the S23 Ultra, has a 6.8-inch screen.

Qualcomm is providing the main chip of the new Samsung phones in at least some regions. The S24 line-up will be based on its Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 applications processor, the company said in a separate statement. That component offers the latest Wi-fi capabilities and will handle AI-assisted features such as live translation and transcription, Qualcomm said.

The new models come at a crucial time for Samsung, which is contending with market share losses and a broader smartphone slump. Last year, it lost its crown as the No 1 smartphone supplier to Apple, marking the first time Samsung has not led the market since 2010.

Samsung’s phone shipments declined nearly 14 per cent to 226.6 million units in 2023, according to research firm IDC. Apple, on the other hand, saw unit shipments increase 3.7 per cent to 234.6 million.

Samsung looks to reverse its fortunes by getting a several-month head start on AI. Apple is not expected to showcase its latest plans for artificial intelligence until June, ahead of new iPhones arriving around September. The new Galaxy phones come out on January 31, with pre-orders starting Wednesday.

Samsung decided to adopt the Gemini AI technology after surveying offerings from competitors, according to Thomas Kurian, head of Google’s cloud computing unit. As part of a multi-year agreement, Google will be the sole provider of generative AI for Samsung’s phones and applications, including features for taking notes and recording audio, according to Kurian.

“This is a validation of the quality of our models,” Kurian said. “They were free to choose whoever they wanted.”

Users will be able to switch between two options: one called Gemini Nano that runs on the phone itself and a higher-powered Pro version that uses cloud computing. That flexibility helped Google’s offerings stand out from the competition, Kurian said.

In conjunction with Samsung’s announcements, Google also introduced a feature called “Circle to Search,” which lets people search anything on their phone screens without switching apps.

Users of Google’s Android operating system can scribble or circle on top of images, text or video in the app they are on – say, YouTube Shorts or TikTok – to find out more information about the item. The feature is launching globally on the new Galaxy S24, as well as on Google’s own Pixel 8 smartphones on January 31.

AI features on the Samsung devices will also let users change the language of a message depending on the context, such as whether it is a work memo or social media post. And new capabilities for Android Auto – Google’s in-car interface – will summarise incoming text messages and other alerts.

The companies are also applying AI to the phones’ camera systems, which are getting upgraded with new sensors, with tools to make photos sharper. The S24 Ultra replaces one of its 10-megapixel telephoto cameras with a 50-megapixel version. The S24 and S24+, meanwhile, include the same camera specifications as their predecessors.

The S24 Ultra comes with as much as 1 terabyte of storage, while the S24+ tops out at 512 gigabytes. The S24 has as much as 256GB of space. The S24+ and S24 Ultra include 12GB of memory, which is used for shorter-term storage of data, while the regular S24 has 8GB.

item.title: Google to let global Android users search for content within other apps
item.description:
Summary：

谷歌新推出“搜索圈”功能，安卓用户将可以在任意其他应用内选择文本、图片或视频，然后使用谷歌进行搜索，无需离开该应用。此功能将从 1 月 31 日开始逐步推出。谷歌表示，该功能将为用户提供快速获取信息的方式，并有望提高应用参与度和展示内容的吸引力。
  • Abstract: Introducing a new feature to search in other apps without leaving.
  • Theme: Google aims to boost search engine and app developer engagement through the introduction of the Circle to Search feature.
  • Viewpoint: This new feature is seen as a way to improve user experience and drive traffic to apps by seamlessly integrating search functions within them.
  • Main information: The Circle to Search feature enables users to select content in other apps, activate the feature with a long press, and search for details within the app itself.

总结：

谷歌推出新功能“搜索圈”，安卓用户可以在其他应用中选择文字、图片或视频，然后使用谷歌搜索，无需离开该应用。该功能将于 1 月 31 日开始逐步推出。谷歌表示，此举旨在为用户提供快速获取信息的方式，并有可能提高应用的参与度和展示内容的吸引力。
  • 摘要：推出新功能可在其他应用中搜索，无需离开应用。
  • 主题：谷歌通过推出“搜索圈”功能，旨在提高搜索引擎的知名度和应用开发者参与度。
  • 观点：此项新功能被视为改善用户体验和通过在应用程序内无缝集成搜索功能来提高流量的一种方式。
  • 主要信息：“搜索圈”功能使用户能够选择其他应用程序中的内容，通过长按激活功能，然后在应用程序本身内搜索详细信息。

单词：

  • enable (v.) - /ɪˈneɪb(ə)l/ 使能够，使有可能。

    原文例句：Google’s new Circle to Search feature, to be rolled out “gradually” from January 31 on some premium Android smartphones, will allow users to select text, images or videos in any other apps, and have Google search them within the apps.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Old French，由en-（使）和able（能够）组成，意为“使能够，使有可能”。在这个例句中，它表示谷歌新的“搜索圈”功能将允许用户在任何其他应用程序中选择文本、图像或视频，并在应用程序内使用谷歌搜索它们。

  • activation (n.) - /ˌæktɪˈveɪʃ(ə)n/ 激活，启动。

    原文例句：after they activate the Circle to Search function by long-pressing their Android phone’s home button or navigation bar, the company said.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由ac-（向……）和tivare（使……活跃）组成，意为“激活，启动”。在这个例句中，它表示用户通过长按安卓手机的主页按钮或导航栏来激活“搜索圈”功能。

词组：

  • search engine - 搜索引擎。

    原文例句：Google’s new Circle to Search feature, to be rolled out “gradually” from January 31 on some premium Android smartphones, will allow users to select text, images or videos in any other apps, and have Google search them within the apps, the US technology giant said on Thursday.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由search（搜索）和engine（引擎）构成的，表示“搜索引擎”。在这个例句中，它指的是谷歌的搜索引擎，即用于在互联网上搜索信息和数据的软件程序。

  • long-press (v.) - 长按。

    原文例句：after they activate the Circle to Search function by long-pressing their Android phone’s home button or navigation bar, the company said.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由long（长的）和press（按压）构成的，表示“长按”。在这个例句中，它表示用户需要长按安卓手机的主页按钮或导航栏来激活“搜索圈”功能。

句子：

  • Google’s new Circle to Search feature, to be rolled out “gradually” from January 31 on some premium Android smartphones, will allow users to select text, images or videos in any other apps, and have Google search them within the apps, the US technology giant said on Thursday. - 谷歌的新功能“搜索圈”将于1月31日起在部分高端安卓智能手机上“逐步推出”，将允许用户在任何其他应用程序中选择文本、图像或视频，并在应用程序内使用谷歌搜索它们，这家美国科技巨头周四表示。

    • 句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Google’s new Circle to Search feature will allow users to select text, images or videos in any other apps, and have Google search them within the apps，其中主语是Google’s new Circle to Search feature，谓语是will allow，宾语是users to select text, images or videos in any other apps, and have Google search them within the apps。to be rolled out “gradually” from January 31 on some premium Android smartphones是一个过去分词短语作状语，修饰主句，表示这一功能将于1月31日起在部分高端安卓智能手机上“逐步推出”。the US technology giant said on Thursday是一个现在分词短语作状语，修饰主句，表示这一消息是这家美国科技巨头周四表示的。这个句子的意思是说，谷歌的新功能“搜索圈”将于1月31日起在部分高端安卓智能手机上“逐步推出”，将允许用户在任何其他应用程序中选择文本、图像或视频，并在应用程序内使用谷歌搜索它们，这一消息是这家美国科技巨头周四表示的。

语法：

  • 定语从句 - 用于修饰名词或代词。

    原文例句：Google’s new Circle to Search feature, to be rolled out “gradually” from January 31 on some premium Android smartphones, will allow users to select text, images or videos in any other apps, and have Google search them within the apps, the US technology giant said on Thursday.

    语法讲解：定语从句是用来修饰名词或代词的从句，它位于被修饰的名词或代词之后，用以提供更多关于被修饰词的信息。定语从句的连接词有who、which、that、when、where、why等。在这个例句中，定语从句是to be rolled out “gradually” from January 31 on some premium Android smartphones，它修饰名词feature，提供了该功能将于1月31日起在部分高端安卓智能手机上“逐步推出”的信息。

  • 不定式 - 可以作名词、形容词或副词。

    原文例句：Google’s new Circle to Search feature, to be rolled out “gradually” from January 31 on some premium Android smartphones, will allow users to select text, images or videos in any other apps, and have Google search them within the apps, the US technology giant said on Thursday.

    语法讲解：不定式是由to加动词原形构成的动词形式，它可以作名词、形容词或副词。不定式作名词时，表示动词所表示的动作或状态，可以用作主语、宾语、表语或同位语。在这个例句中，不定式是to be rolled out，它作状语，表示该功能将于1月31日起在部分高端安卓智能手机上“逐步推出”。

  • The Circle to Search feature, available from January 31 on some premium Android smartphones, will enable quick access to information without having to leave the app
  • Google did not disclose when the new function will be available on iPhones

Google will let global Android smartphone users search for content in other applications without having to exit them, a move aimed at boosting its search engine and driving engagement for app developers.

Google’s new Circle to Search feature, to be rolled out “gradually” from January 31 on some premium Android smartphones, will allow users to select text, images or videos in any other apps, and have Google search them within the apps, the US technology giant said on Thursday.

For example, users will be able to search for details on what a content creator is wearing in a video by circling or tapping on the items, after they activate the Circle to Search function by long-pressing their Android phone’s home button or navigation bar, the company said.

Apple gets deeper into China’s smartphone price wars with broad iPhone discounts

The feature will enable quick access to information without having to leave the app, potentially driving engagement for apps and the content displayed, it said.

Early testing showed that users “typically return to the app they’re using” after activating the feature, according to Google.

The company did not disclose when the function will be available on iPhones, with a representative telling the South China Morning Post that it “looks forward to bringing this powerful new capability to more people over time”. Android handsets that will feature the new function will include the Samsung Electronics’ new Galaxy S24 Series, it said.

Google parent Alphabet’s revenue in the three months ending September 30 rose 11 per cent from the same period a year before, which the company attributed to “meaningful growth” in search and YouTube, according to its earnings report published in October. Advertising revenue grew 9.5 per cent year on year to US$59.6 billion.

The company is still facing uncertainties in Hong Kong, where the government is seeking to have the US technology giant remove the protest song “Glory to Hong Kong”, which became popular during anti-government unrest in the city in 2019. Google has expressed unwillingness to ban the song from its search engine without a court order.

While a Hong Kong court blocked the government’s injunction bid in July, a month later it allowed the city’s government to appeal the decision.

item.title: Huawei sets up new smart car unit as it accelerates automotive ambitions in wake of earlier deal with Changan
item.description:
Summary：

Huawei Technologies has established a new smart car company named Shenzhen Yinwang Intelligent Technology, investing 1 billion yuan (US$140.3 million). This move follows Huawei's partnership with Changan Automobile in November to form a joint venture in the smart car industry. The new company focuses on smart car equipment, AI system integration, and software development.
  • Abstract: Huawei enters the smart car market with a new company, Shenzhen Yinwang Intelligent Technology.
  • Theme: Huawei expands its influence in the automotive sector, aiming to integrate its smart car solutions into a new venture.
  • Viewpoint: Huawei's strategic partnership with Changan Automobile to establish a joint venture in smart car development.
  • Main information: Registered capital of 1 billion yuan; business scope includes smart car equipment, AI integration, and software development; collaboration with Changan Automobile and potential industry partners.

总结：

华为技术公司已经成立一家智能汽车公司，名为深圳银王智能科技有限公司，投资10亿元人民币（1.403亿美元）。此举是继去年11月华为与长安汽车签署合作备忘录组建智能汽车合资公司之后做出的。这家新公司专注于智能汽车设备、人工智能系统集成和软件开发。
  • 摘要：华为以新公司深圳银王智能科技有限公司，进军智能汽车市场。
  • 主题：华为扩大其在汽车行业的规模，旨在将其智能汽车解决方案整合到新的合资企业中。
  • 观点：华为与长安汽车在智能汽车开发方面建立合资企业的战略合作。
  • 主要信息：注册资本10亿元人民币；业务范围包括智能汽车设备、人工智能集成和软件开发；与长安汽车以及潜在的行业合作伙伴合作。

单词：

  • venture (n.) - /ˈventʃər/ 冒险事业，风险企业。

    原文例句：Huawei Technologies has set up a new smart car company as the US-sanctioned telecoms equipment giant steps up its ambitions in the automobile industry, following its earlier announcement of a joint venture (JV) with Chinese state-owned carmaker Changan Automobile.

    例句讲解：venture在这里作名词，意为“冒险事业，风险企业”。华为技术公司成立了一家新的智能汽车公司，因为这家受到美国制裁的电信设备巨头正在加强其在汽车行业的雄心，继此前宣布与中国国有汽车制造商长安汽车建立合资企业 (JV)。

  • stake (n.) - /steɪk/ 股权，股份。

    原文例句：Richard Yu Chengdong, CEO of Huawei’s consumer business group and chairman of its Intelligent Automotive Solution business unit, called on Chinese carmakers Seres Group, Chery Automobile, JAC Motors and BAIC Motor to take an equity stake in the Huawei-Changan JV.

    例句讲解：stake在这里作名词，意为“股权，股份”。余承东，华为消费者业务集团首席执行官兼智能汽车解决方案业务单元董事长，呼吁中国汽车制造商赛力斯集团、奇瑞汽车、江汽汽车和北汽汽车入股华为-长安合资企业。

词组：

  • take an equity stake in - 入股，参股。

    原文例句：Richard Yu Chengdong, CEO of Huawei’s consumer business group and chairman of its Intelligent Automotive Solution business unit, called on Chinese carmakers Seres Group, Chery Automobile, JAC Motors and BAIC Motor to take an equity stake in the Huawei-Changan JV.

    例句讲解：take an equity stake in是一个动词词组，意为“入股，参股”。余承东，华为消费者业务集团首席执行官兼智能汽车解决方案业务单元董事长，呼吁中国汽车制造商赛力斯集团、奇瑞汽车、江汽汽车和北汽汽车入股华为-长安合资企业。

句子：

  • Huawei’s HarmonyOS tipped to beat Apple’s iOS in China in 2024: TechInsights - “TechInsights：华为HarmonyOS预计在2024年超越苹果iOS在中国市场”。

    句子分析：这是一个主谓宾结构的句子，主语是“TechInsights：华为HarmonyOS预计在2024年超越苹果iOS在中国市场”，谓语是“tipped”，宾语是“beat Apple’s iOS in China in 2024”。tipped在这里作过去分词，意为“被认为，被预计”。

语法：

  • 被动语态 - 表示动作或状态是由句子主语以外的人或物执行或引起的。

    原文例句：Huawei Technologies has set up a new smart car company.

    语法讲解：这句话使用被动语态，表示动作“set up”是由句子主语以外的人或物执行或引起的。在这里，句子主语是“Huawei Technologies”，动作“set up”是由华为技术公司执行的。因此，这句话可以改写为“A new smart car company has been set up by Huawei Technologies”。

  • 现在完成时 - 表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，并且现在已经完成。

    原文例句：The new venture was set up by Huawei’s car unit to serve the industry better with its smart car solutions

    语法讲解：这句话使用现在完成时，表示动作“set up”从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，并且现在已经完成。在这里，动作“set up”发生在过去，但其结果或影响一直持续到现在。因此，这句话可以改写为“The new venture has been set up by Huawei’s car unit to serve the industry better with its smart car solutions”。

  • The new company, named Shenzhen Yinwang Intelligent Technology, has a registered capital of 1 billion yuan
  • Development comes after Huawei signed a memorandum of cooperation in November with Changan Automobile

Huawei Technologies has set up a new smart car company as the US-sanctioned telecoms equipment giant steps up its ambitions in the automobile industry, following its earlier announcement of a joint venture (JV) with Chinese state-owned carmaker Changan Automobile.

The new company, named Shenzhen Yinwang Intelligent Technology, was set up on Tuesday with a registered capital of 1 billion yuan (US$140.3 million) and is wholly owned by Huawei, according to records on business registry information platform Tianyancha.

The records show that the new firm’s business covers smart car equipment manufacturing, artificial intelligence (AI) system integration services, and AI software development, among other areas.

The development comes after Huawei signed a memorandum of cooperation in November with Changan Automobile, a major state-owned carmaker based in Chongqing, southwestern Sichuan province, to start a new smart car JV.

Under the partnership, Huawei said it plans to transfer its smart-car system business to a new unit with investments from Changan Automobile and “integrate the core technologies and resources of [Huawei’s] smart car solutions into the new company”.

Huawei’s HarmonyOS tipped to beat Apple’s iOS in China in 2024: TechInsights

The new venture was set up by Huawei’s car unit to serve the industry better with its smart car solutions, according to a person familiar with the situation who declined to be named. Huawei declined to comment on the relationship between the new entity and its JV with Changan.

While Huawei currently holds 100 per cent of the new firm, it is open to more industry partners joining to become a technology platform with diversified equity, according to a report by Chinese media outlet Securities Times.

In November, Richard Yu Chengdong, CEO of Huawei’s consumer business group and chairman of its Intelligent Automotive Solution business unit, called on Chinese carmakers Seres Group, Chery Automobile, JAC Motors and BAIC Motor to take an equity stake in the Huawei-Changan JV.

All four of these companies – generally considered smaller carmakers in the country – currently partner with Huawei to develop and sell new brands under the so-called Huawei Select model, through which the smartphone giant collaborates closely with companies on everything from product design to sales. These brands include Aito with Seres and Luxeed with Chery.

At Changan’s global partnership conference on Tuesday, the automaker’s chairman Zhu Huarong revealed that Huawei had promised not to produce cars under their JV deal, which was sealed within three months of initiating discussions, according to a live-streamed video of the event.

Zhu also said that the two companies are in the process of discussing the details of their partnership and its establishment, which is tentatively named “Newcool” in English.

The Huawei-Changan JV will also be open to more firms, Zhu said, adding that it will focus on seven main businesses including intelligent automotive systems, smart cockpits and a digital platform.

item.title: China’s IC output grew 6.9% in 2023, defying weaker customer demand, tighter US sanctions
item.description:
English summary：

China's total integrated circuit (IC) output increased by 6.9% year-on-year in 2023, despite weak demand from smartphone and computer makers and tighter US sanctions. Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp (SMIC), China's largest chip foundry, saw its wafer shipments decline by 24% due to weaker customer demand. Industry analysts predict that weak demand will continue in the first quarter of 2024, with signs of recovery only visible in the second quarter. China's overall semiconductor exports decreased in volume and value in 2023, while imports also declined in volume and value.
  • Abstract: China's IC output increased in 2023 despite market challenges; SMIC's wafer shipments declined; weak demand and US sanctions impacted the industry.
  • Theme: China's semiconductor industry faced challenges in 2023, including weaker demand and US sanctions, resulting in decreased output and exports.
  • Viewpoint: China needs to address industry overcrowding, improve capacity utilization, and focus on developing advanced technologies to become more competitive in the global semiconductor market.
  • Main information: China's total IC output increased by 6.9% in 2023; SMIC's wafer shipments declined by 24%; weak demand and US sanctions affected the industry; China's IC exports and imports decreased in volume and value.

中文总结：

2023年，中国集成电路（IC）总产量同比增长6.9%，但智能手机和电脑制造商需求疲软，美国制裁加剧，导致半导体制造国际公司（SMIC）晶圆出货量下降24%。行业分析师预计，2024年第一季度需求疲软仍将持续，第二季度才可能出现复苏迹象。2023年，中国半导体出口数量和价值均有所下降，进口数量和价值也出现下降。
  • 摘要：2023年中国IC产量增长，但市场挑战重重；SMIC晶圆出货量下降；需求疲软和美国制裁影响行业。
  • 主题：2023年中国半导体行业面临需求疲软、美国制裁等挑战，导致产量和出口下降。
  • 观点：中国需要解决行业产能过剩问题，提高产能利用率，专注于发展先进技术，才能在全球半导体市场上更具竞争力。
  • 主要信息：中国2023年IC总产量增长6.9%；SMIC晶圆出货量下降24%；需求疲软和美国制裁影响行业；中国IC出口和进口数量、价值均下降。

单词：

  • prevailing (adj.) - /prɪˈveɪlɪŋ/ 流行，流行的。

    原文例句：Overall semiconductor foundry capacity utilisation rates are still under downward pressure amid the prevailing economic turbulence this quarter, Taiwan-based IC research company TrendForce said in a recent note.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于French，原意为“占上风，流行”。在这个例句中，它形容了当前经济动荡下，半导体代工厂的产能利用率仍然处于下降的压力下。

  • turbulence (n.) - /ˈtɜːbjʊləns/ 动荡，混乱。

    原文例句：Overall semiconductor foundry capacity utilisation rates are still under downward pressure amid the prevailing economic turbulence this quarter, Taiwan-based IC research company TrendForce said in a recent note.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，原意为“骚动，混乱”。在这个例句中，它形容了当前经济的不稳定和不确定性。

  • equilibrium (n.) - /ˌeːkwɪˈlɪbrɪəm/ 平衡，均衡。

    原文例句：TrendForce predicted that foundry inventory levels will improve in the second quarter, returning to a healthier equilibrium despite the continuing murky outlook for end-customer orders.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，原意为“平衡”。在这个例句中，它形容了代工厂的库存水平在第二季度将有所改善，尽管终端客户订单的前景仍然不明朗，但库存水平将回归到一个更健康的平衡状态。

词组：

  • capacity utilisation - 产能利用率。

    原文例句：SMIC’s total shipments of wafers from January to September 2023 declined by 24 per cent year on year, reflecting weaker demand from its main customers in sectors spanning from smartphones to carmakers.

    例句讲解：产能利用率是指企业实际产量与生产能力的比值，反映了企业产能的实际使用情况。在这个例句中，它指从2023年1月到9月，SMIC的晶圆总出货量同比下降24%，反映了其主要客户需求疲软。

句子：

  • The country produced 351.4 billion ICs last year, compared with 324.2 billion in 2022, according to data published by China’s National Bureau of Statistics. - 去年，该国生产了3514亿块集成电路，而2022年为3242亿块，根据中国国家统计局公布的数据。

    • 句子分析：这是一个简单句，主语是The country，谓语是produced，宾语是351.4 billion ICs。compared with 324.2 billion in 2022是一个介词短语，表示与2022年相比。according to data published by China’s National Bureau of Statistics是一个介词短语，表示根据中国国家统计局公布的数据。这个句子的意思是说，去年，该国生产了3514亿块集成电路，而2022年为3242亿块，根据中国国家统计局公布的数据。

语法：

  • 过去时态 - 表示过去发生的动作或状态。

    原文例句：China’s total output of integrated circuits (ICs) in 2023 increased 6.9 per cent from a year earlier despite sluggish demand at one of its largest wafer foundries in the second half.

    语法讲解：这是一个过去时态的句子，表示2023年中国集成电路的总产量比前一年增长了6.9%，尽管下半年其最大的晶圆代工厂之一的需求疲软。

  • The country produced 351.4 billion ICs last year, compared with 324.2 billion in 2022, according to data published by China’s National Bureau of Statistics
  • SMIC’s total shipments of wafers from January to September 2023 declined by 24 per cent year on year, reflecting weaker demand from its main customers

China’s total output of integrated circuits (ICs) in 2023 increased 6.9 per cent from a year earlier despite sluggish demand at one of its largest wafer foundries in the second half.

The country produced 351.4 billion ICs last year, compared with 324.2 billion in 2022, according to data published on Wednesday by China’s National Bureau of Statistics (NBS).

The NBS data counted a variety of chips to reach the total IC number, including logic, memory, analogue and special chips, plus sensors and chip modules.

In 2023, China’s semiconductor manufacturing industry was marred by factors such as weaker economic post-pandemic recovery, sluggish demand from smartphone and personal-computer makers, and tighter US-led sanctions that restricted its access to advanced technologies.

China chip design expert warns of losses due to industry overcrowding

China’s top foundry Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp (SMIC), which derived 84 per cent of its total revenue from the domestic market in the third quarter, saw its capacity utilisation rate fall to an average of 74 per cent in the first three quarters of last year, compared with 96 per cent in the same period the year before.

SMIC’s total shipments of wafers from January to September 2023 declined by 24 per cent year on year, reflecting weaker demand from its main customers in sectors spanning from smartphones to carmakers.

The company will report its fourth-quarter and full-year results on February 7.

The market softness was also felt by China’s second-largest foundry Hua Hong Semiconductor, which saw revenue in the first nine months of last year drop 0.79 per year on year, while third-quarter capacity utilisation sank to 86.8 per cent from a capacity overload situation in the second quarter, according to data from the company.

Industry analysts have predicted the sluggish demand to continue in the current quarter, with signs of recovery only becoming visible in the second quarter.

Overall semiconductor foundry capacity utilisation rates are still under downward pressure amid the prevailing economic turbulence this quarter, Taiwan-based IC research company TrendForce said in a recent note.

TrendForce predicted that foundry inventory levels will improve in the second quarter, returning to a healthier equilibrium despite the continuing murky outlook for end-customer orders.

Separately, China exported a total of 267.8 billion ICs worth US$135.9 billion in 2023, down 1.8 per cent by volume and 10.1 per cent lower in value from 2022.

Meanwhile, China imported 479.5 billion IC units worth US$349.4 billion, down 10.8 per cent by volume and 15.4 per cent in value from 2022, official data showed.

item.title: China’s internet giants must step up opening their ‘walled gardens’, state media says, ahead of Tencent flagship game’s return to Douyin
item.description:
Summary：

中国证券时报的一篇文章指出，中国互联网行业内这些科技巨头之间的合作“远未深入”。在腾讯王者荣耀回归抖音平台前几天，提出了打破中国互联网行业更多数字壁垒的呼吁。这篇文章说，中国的主要互联网公司“需要更加开放”，才能让它们的生态系统跨平台运行，这被视为“共同面对市场压力”并确保行业进一步扩展的手段。
  • Abstract: China’s internet giants urged to tear down 'walled gardens' across platforms.
  • Theme: Break down more digital barriers among internet companies to promote win-win cooperation and industry expansion.
  • Viewpoint: The significance of open-mindedness and inclusivity in internet collaborations; the need to leverage each other's strengths to face market challenges.
  • Main information: Collaboration between ByteDance and Tencent, such as Tencent authorizing Douyin to distribute its video content and clarifying copyright rules; other cases of cooperation, like Alibaba opening a store on JD.com; the expanded collaboration between Tencent and Alibaba.

总结：

中国证券时报的一篇文章指出，中国互联网行业内这些科技巨头之间的合作“远未深入”。在腾讯王者荣耀回归抖音平台前几天，提出了打破中国互联网行业更多数字壁垒的呼吁。文章表示，中国的互联网巨头必须加快开放“围墙花园”的步伐，使他们的生态系统能够跨平台运行，以此作为“共同应对市场压力”并确保行业进一步扩展的手段。截至目前，根据深圳证券时报周二发表的一篇报道，这些公司之间的合作“远未深入”，该报是隶属于中国共产党喉舌《人民日报》的金融报纸。文章说，中国的互联网公司“需要更加开明，更具包容性”，才能在行业内促进真正双赢的合作。
  • 摘要：中国互联网巨头们被敦促打破平台之间的“围墙花园”。
  • 主题：打破互联网公司之间的更多数字壁垒，促进合作共赢和行业发展。
  • 观点：互联网合作中开放包容性的重要性；需要利用各自优势应对市场挑战。
  • 主要信息：字节跳动与腾讯的合作，例如腾讯授权抖音分发其视频内容并明确版权规则；其他合作案例，如阿里巴巴在京东商城开设店铺；腾讯与阿里巴巴的深度合作。

单词：

  • collaboration (n.) - /kəˌlæbəˈreɪʃən/ 合作，协作。

    原文例句：At present, collaborations among these companies “are far from deep”, said an article published on Tuesday by Shenzhen-based Securities Times, a financial newspaper owned by the Chinese Communist Party mouthpiece People’s Daily.

    例句讲解：本词源于拉丁语“collaborare”，意为“共同劳动”，指两个或多个个体或组织共同努力完成某项任务的行为。在这个例句中，它指的是中国互联网公司之间的合作。

  • ecosystem (n.) - /ˈikəʊsɪstəm/ 生态系统，生态圈。

    原文例句：China’s internet giants must accelerate efforts to open up their “walled gardens”, enabling their ecosystems to work across platforms as a means “to face market pressures together” and assure the industry’s further expansion, according to state-owned media.

    例句讲解：本词由“eco-”和“-system”组成，前者来自希腊语“oikos”，意为“家、住所”，后者意为“系统”。它指由生物与其环境之间相互作用而形成的系统，强调生物与环境的相互依存关系。在这个例句中，它指的是互联网巨头各自的平台和用户群体及其之间的相互作用。

  • regulatory uncertainty (n.) - /ˈrɛɡjələt(ə)ri ˌʌnsərˈteɪnti/ 监管不确定性。

    原文例句：The collaboration between ByteDance and Tencent comes amid the video gaming industry’s regulatory uncertainties and a weaker macro environment in China.

    例句讲解：本词由“regulatory”（监管的）和“uncertainty”（不确定性）组成，表示政府监管政策的不确定性。在这个例句中，它指的是中国视频游戏行业面临的监管政策的不确定性。

词组：

  • break down (v.) - 拆除，打破。

    原文例句：Beijing wants to smash online walls but Big Tech treads carefully.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由break（打破）和down（向下）组成的，表示“拆除，打破”。在这个例句中，它表示北京想要打破互联网上的壁垒。

  • cross-platform (adj.) - 跨平台的。

    原文例句：Tencent allows Douyin to air Honour of Kings videos as ByteDance exits gaming.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由cross（跨越）和platform（平台）组成的，表示“跨平台的”。在这个例句中，它表示腾讯允许抖音播放王者荣耀的视频。

句子：

  • China’s internet giants must accelerate efforts to open up their “walled gardens”, enabling their ecosystems to work across platforms as a means “to face market pressures together” and assure the industry’s further expansion, according to state-owned media. - 中国的互联网巨头必须加快开放“围墙花园”的步伐，使他们的生态系统能够跨平台运行，以此作为“共同应对市场压力”并确保行业进一步扩展的手段，据国有媒体报道。

    句子分析：这是个长句，包含一个主句和一个从句。主句是：China’s internet giants must accelerate efforts to open up their “walled gardens”，主语是China’s internet giants，谓语是must accelerate efforts to open up their “walled gardens”。从句是：enabling their ecosystems to work across platforms as a means “to face market pressures together” and assure the industry’s further expansion，它作状语，修饰主句。这个句子的意思是说，中国的互联网巨头必须加快开放“围墙花园”的步伐，使他们的生态系统能够跨平台运行，以此作为“共同应对市场压力”并确保行业进一步扩展的手段。

语法：

  • 倒装句型 - 强调句中的某个成分。

    原文例句：Increased collaboration between China’s major internet companies are expected to not only benefit consumers, but help further expand the industry, according to state media.

    语法讲解：倒装句型是在英语中将通常放在句首的成分放在句中或句末，以强调该成分。在该句中，Increased collaboration between China’s major internet companies被放在句首，强调了中国主要互联网公司之间加强合作的重要性。后面的are expected to not only benefit consumers, but help further expand the industry是对increased collaboration between China’s major internet companies的解释，说明了加强合作的好处。

  • 虚拟语气 - 表示说话人对某件事的主观态度。

    原文例句：TikTok owner ByteDance earlier this month confirmed that it was in talks with multiple potential buyers, including Tencent, to sell its video gaming operations.

    语法讲解：虚拟语气是在英语中用来表示说话人对某件事的主观态度的一种语法结构。在该句中，was in talks with multiple potential buyers, including Tencent, to sell its video gaming operations使用了虚拟语气，表示TikTok所有者字节跳动正在与包括腾讯在内的多家潜在买家谈判，以出售其视频游戏业务这一信息是不确定的或带有主观性的。

  • Collaborations among these Big Tech firms ‘are far from deep’, according to an article by Securities Times
  • The call to break more digital barriers in China’s internet industry comes days before Tencent’s Honour of Kings returns to Douyin’s platform

China’s internet giants must accelerate efforts to open up their “walled gardens”, enabling their ecosystems to work across platforms as a means “to face market pressures together” and assure the industry’s further expansion, according to state-owned media.

At present, collaborations among these companies “are far from deep”, said an article published on Tuesday by Shenzhen-based Securities Times, a financial newspaper owned by the Chinese Communist Party mouthpiece People’s Daily.

The call to break more digital barriers in China’s internet industry comes days before Tencent Holdings’ Honour of Kings, the world’s most popular mobile game, officially returns to the popular live-streaming platform of ByteDance-owned Douyin, which has more than 600 million daily active users, from January 21.

“In the future, internet companies need to be more open-minded and inclusive to promote truly win-win cooperation in the industry,” the Securities Times article said.

The collaboration between ByteDance and Tencent comes amid the video gaming industry’s regulatory uncertainties and a weaker macro environment in China.

While China’s gross domestic product rose by 5.2 per cent year on year in 2023, the world’s second-largest economy still faced mounting concerns this year including waning investor confidence, a protracted property market slump and a weak private sector.

“Internet companies need to leverage each other to face the market pressures together,” the Securities Times article said.

TikTok owner ByteDance earlier this month confirmed that it was in talks with multiple potential buyers, including Tencent, to sell its video gaming operations.

Last April, Tencent and Douyin agreed to a partnership in video content distribution after years of contentious copyright disputes.

Tencent allows Douyin to air Honour of Kings videos as ByteDance exits gaming

Under that deal, Tencent authorised Douyin to distribute its video content and clarify copyright rules for users to produce modifications and adaptations. As a result, users of ByteDance-owned platforms Douyin, Xigua Video and Jinri Toutiao will be able to produce derivative works based on Tencent-owned videos.

There have been other cases of collaboration between rival internet platform operators over the years,

In November, Alibaba Group Holding’s grocery chain Freshippo opened a store on rival e-commerce giant JD.com. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.

Beijing wants to smash online walls but Big Tech treads carefully

Tencent’s super app WeChat and Alibaba’s Taobao and Tmall Group in September announced an expanded collaboration, which enabled users who click on advertisements on WeChat to be directed to shops and live-streaming campaigns on Taobao and Tmall.

In November 2021, Tencent opened WeChat to third-party online links including those of Douyin and Taobao.

In September that same year, Alibaba started allowing consumers to use Tencent’s WeChat Pay as a payment option on a number of its platforms including food delivery platform Ele.me, video-streaming platform Youku, online ticketing platform Damai and cross-border e-commerce platform Kaola.

item.title: China’s hi-tech manufacturing faces ‘extraordinary pressures’ as 2023 output stalls
item.description:
English summary：

  • China's hi-tech manufacturing industry reported a record low 2.7% growth rate in 2023, amid economic slowdown and escalating US containment efforts.
  • The decline in growth has affected Beijing's ambitions to become a global superpower and find new economic drivers.
  • Investment in hi-tech manufacturing saw a slower 9.9% increase, pointing to cooling market confidence.
  • Experts attributed the slowdown to global economic uncertainty, US-China tensions, and deglobalization trends.
  • The Chinese government is pushing for innovation and transformation of traditional industries to counter these challenges.

中文总结：

  • 2023年中国高技术制造业产值同比增长2.7%，创下2018年开始记录以来的最低增速。
  • 增速放缓影响了北京成为全球超级大国的野心，并寻找新的经济驱动因素。
  • 对高技术制造业的投资增长放缓至 9.9%，表明市场信心正在冷却。
  • 专家将经济低迷归因于全球经济不确定性、中美贸易争端和全球化趋势。
  • 中国政府正在推动传统产业的创新和转型，以应对这些挑战。

单词：

  • decouple (v.) - 脱钩，分离（通常指经济上的）。

    原文例句：“The hi-tech recovery will require China to return to higher economic growth and counteract US decoupling. ”

    例句讲解：“decouple”在经济领域中常常被翻译为“脱钩”。这个单词来源于拉丁语，由de（分开）和couple（联系）组成，意为“将……脱离开来”。在这个例句中，它指的是美国与中国在经济上的脱钩。

  • valuation (n.) - 估价，价值评估。

    原文例句：“Even if these tech manufacturers succeed in going public, the potential sanctions would affect their market valuations.”

    例句讲解：“valuation”在经济领域中常常被翻译为“估值”。这个单词来源于拉丁语，由value（价值）和-ation（结果）组成，意为“价值评估”。在这个例句中，它指的是科技制造商在公开上市后的市场价值评估。

词组：

  • cool down - 冷却，缓和。

    原文例句：“The sector is heading into a cooling period after years of rapid expansion.”

    例句讲解：“cool down”这个词组来源于动词cool（冷却）和副词down（向下），意为“冷却，缓和”。在这个例句中，它指的是高技术制造业在快速扩张后进入了一个冷却期。

  • scale up - 扩大，扩展。

    原文例句：“Even if these tech manufacturers succeed in going public, the potential sanctions would affect their market valuations.”

    例句讲解：“scale up”这个词组来源于动词scale（比例）和副词up（向上），意为“扩大，扩展”。在这个例句中，它指的是高技术制造商的市场估值受到潜在制裁的影响。

句子：

  • Chen Zhiwu, a chair professor of finance at the University of Hong Kong, said headwinds such as risks of a global recession and US-China tensions would continue to exert “extraordinary pressures” on China’s hi-tech push.

    句子分析：这是一个复杂句，主句是Chen Zhiwu said，其中主语是Chen Zhiwu，谓语是said，宾语是headwinds such as risks of a global recession and US-China tensions would continue to exert “extraordinary pressures” on China’s hi-tech push。headwinds such as risks of a global recession and US-China tensions would continue to exert “extraordinary pressures” on China’s hi-tech push是一个主语从句，其中主语是headwinds such as risks of a global recession and US-China tensions，谓语是would continue to exert “extraordinary pressures” on China’s hi-tech push。extraordinary pressures是一个形容词短语，作宾语，表示巨大的压力。这个句子的意思是说，香港大学金融系主任陈志武表示，全球经济衰退风险和中美贸易争端等不利因素将继续给中国高科技发展带来“巨大压力”。

语法：

  • 虚拟语气 - 用于表示虚拟、假设或不真实的情况。

    原文例句：“The hi-tech recovery will require China to return to higher economic growth and counteract US decoupling.”

    语法讲解：“will require”是一个虚拟语气，表示一种必要性或迫切性。在这个例句中，它指的是高科技复苏需要中国提高经济增长并抵消美国脱钩的影响。虚拟语气的用法有很多种，包括表示愿望、建议、可能、请求、猜测等。

  • Industrial output from hi-tech manufacturers rose by 2.7 per cent year on year in 2023, but this marked the lowest level of growth since records began in 2018
  • Beijing has pinned its hopes on innovation and technology to power the world’s second-largest economy as it seeks to find new growth engines

Output from China’s hi-tech manufacturing sector grew at the slowest pace on record last year amid a faltering economy and ever-escalating containment efforts from the United States, with the decline weighing on Beijing’s march towards superpower status.

Industrial output from hi-tech manufacturers rose by 2.7 per cent year on year in 2023, falling behind an increase of 5 per cent from the overall manufacturing industry, marking the lowest level of growth since the National Bureau of Statistics started to release the figures in 2018.

The hi-tech manufacturing industry had seen its growth soar to a record high of 18.2 per cent in 2021 before easing to 7.4 per cent in 2022, having stood at 7.1 per cent in 2020 amid coronavirus-induced disruptions to the global supply chain.

Beijing has pinned its hopes on innovation and technology to power the world’s second-largest economy as it seeks to find new growth engines to replace the real estate sector, address its demographic challenges and move up the advanced industrial chain.

Investment in hi-tech manufacturing grew by 9.9 per cent last year, beating the 6.5 per cent increase seen in the overall manufacturing industry, but the financing still registered the slowest pace since records began in 2015.

Peng Peng, executive chairman of the Guangdong Society of Reform, said the sector is heading into a cooling period after years of rapid expansion.

“The latest economic data indicate that the whole economic recovery is weak, and market confidence in many sectors is shaky, including tech,” he said.

“The hi-tech recovery will require China to return to higher economic growth and counteract US decoupling.

“It also demands the country’s ability to adapt to deglobalisation, but maintain a strong global exporter role.”

Even if these tech manufacturers succeed in going public, the potential sanctions would affect their market valuationsChen Zhiwu

In December, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology said it would increase funding to nurture the transformation of traditional manufacturers into hi-tech producers.

It said China’s hi-tech manufacturing industry was currently facing challenges from insufficient innovation and increasing external pressure.

Chen Zhiwu, a chair professor of finance at the University of Hong Kong, said headwinds such as risks of a global recession and US-China tensions would continue to exert “extraordinary pressures” on China’s hi-tech push.

‘More, better’: premier urges China to focus on application of core technologies

“The US tech war has largely thwarted Chinese tech companies’ [initial public offering] opportunities. Even if these tech manufacturers succeed in going public, the potential sanctions would affect their market valuations,” said Chen.

He added China’s weak economic momentum is also weighing on the market’s overall willingness to invest, with hi-tech manufacturing just one element.

“The rapid development of hi-tech industries over the past 20 years has provided China with a massive boost to its economic boom, this was partly due to the impact of a stable external environment on investor confidence,” Chen said.

“Many hi-tech companies I’ve surveyed recently said that market demand for tech products is relatively low, and with uncertain market sentiment, consumers are tightening their wallets so much that companies have to cut back on production.”

item.title: Saudi Arabia is eyeing a ‘sizeable’ investment to kick off kingdom’s foray into semiconductors
item.description:
Summary：

Saudi Arabia plans to diversify its economy away from oil and invest in the semiconductor and space industries. The Public Investment Fund (PIF) will invest heavily in semiconductors this year and will announce a leading partner in the space industry. PIF will also establish a national space company and acquire assets in the sector. Saudi Arabia aims to become a regional and global leader in space by 2030 and 2040, respectively. The kingdom seeks to attract investment from both US and Chinese tech companies and emphasizes its commitment to protecting intellectual property and patents.
  • Abstract: Saudi Arabia's economic diversification plans, focusing on the semiconductor and space industries, with investment and leadership initiatives.
  • Theme: The kingdom's efforts to reduce reliance on oil and become a prominent player in technology and innovation.
  • Viewpoint: PIF's leading role in driving the diversification strategy, focusing on attracting global investment and partnerships.
  • Main information: Investments in semiconductors, establishment of a national space company, goals for regional and global leadership in the space industry, commitment to protecting intellectual property, and an open market approach to investment.

总结：

沙特阿拉伯计划多元化其经济，远离石油，投资于半导体和太空产业。公共投资基金（PIF）将今年大力投资半导体，并将在太空行业宣布领先合作伙伴。PIF还将成立一家国家太空公司，并在该行业收购资产。沙特阿拉伯计划在2030年和2040年分别成为太空领域的区域和全球领导者。该王国寻求吸引来自美国和中国的科技公司的投资，并强调其对保护知识产权和专利的承诺。
  • 摘要：沙特阿拉伯经济多元化计划，重点放在半导体和太空产业，以及投资和领导力举措。
  • 主题：该王国努力减少对石油的依赖，并成为技术和创新领域的重要参与者。
  • 观点：PIF在推动多元化战略中的主导作用，重点是吸引全球投资和伙伴关系。
  • 主要信息：半导体投资，成立国家太空公司，太空产业区域和全球领导力目标，保护知识产权的承诺，以及开放市场投资方式。

单词：

  • semi-annual (adj.) - 半年度的，半年一次的，六个月的

    原文例句：This section of the article outlines the policies and procedures that ensure that information systems and services exposed to the public have adequate security measures in place and are protected from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification or destruction as the result of either intentional or accidental human actions, natural disasters or other incidents.

    例句讲解：“半年度的”这个词由semi-（半）和annual（年度）组成，表示“半年一次的，六个月的”。在这个例句中，它指的是信息系统和服务每半年接受一次评估和审查，以确保其安全性。

  • operational (adj.) - 操作的，运营的

    原文例句：In exceptional circumstances, the access of a person to operational computer systems or areas in which operational data are stored (such as offices, workshops, storage depots), may be restricted.

    例句讲解：“操作的，运营的”这个词由operate（操作，运营）演变而来，表示“与操作或运营有关的”。在这个例句中，它指的是对人访问操作计算机系统或存储操作数据的区域（例如办公室、车间、储存仓库）的限制。

词组：

  • come back to - 回到，恢复。

    原文例句：The other thing the FED will probably come back to is communicating the path to raising interest rates.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由come（来）和back（回来）组成，表示“回到，恢复”。在这个例句中，它表示美联储可能会回到提高利率的道路上。

句子：

  • The Public Investment Fund is looking at making a “sizeable investment” this year into the semiconductor industry, Saudi Minister of Communications and Information Technology Abdullah Al-Swaha said in an interview at the World Economic Forum in Davos. - 沙特通讯和信息技术部长 Abdullah Al-Swaha 在达沃斯世界经济论坛的采访中表示，公共投资基金计划今年对半导体行业进行“大额投资”。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Public Investment Fund is looking at making a “sizeable investment”，其中主语是Public Investment Fund，谓语是looking at making，宾语是“sizeable investment”。this year into the semiconductor industry是一个时间状语，表示今年对半导体行业进行“大额投资”。Saudi Minister of Communications and Information Technology Abdullah Al-Swaha said in an interview at the World Economic Forum in Davos是一个现在分词短语作状语，表示Abdullah Al-Swaha在达沃斯世界经济论坛的采访中说这句话，这个句子的意思是说，沙特通讯和信息技术部长 Abdullah Al-Swaha 在达沃斯世界经济论坛的采访中表示，公共投资基金计划今年对半导体行业进行“大额投资”。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，并且现在仍然持续的动作或状态。

    原文例句：The company has been making iPhones and other products in India for several years, including the latest iPhone 15.

    语法讲解：这是一种时态，结构是：have/has + been + 现在分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，它表示这家公司从过去的几年开始一直在印度生产iPhone和其他产品，直到现在仍然在进行。

  • 现在进行时 - 表示正在发生的动作或状态，强调动作或状态的进行性或持续性。

    原文例句：I am writing a letter to my friend.

    语法讲解：这是一种时态，结构是：be + 现在分词。其中be要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态正在发生，强调动作或状态的进行性或持续性。在这个例句中，它表示我正在给我的朋友写信，强调我正在进行这个动作。

  • The Public Investment Fund is looking at making a “sizeable investment” this year into the semiconductor industry, the Saudi communications minister said
  • PIF plans to make an announcement on a particular champion within the space to lead the Saudi efforts, the minister said

Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is planning to make big investments in both the semiconductor and space industries this year as the kingdom accelerates efforts to diversify its economy away from oil.

The Public Investment Fund is looking at making a “sizeable investment” this year into the semiconductor industry, Saudi Minister of Communications and Information Technology Abdullah Al-Swaha said in an interview at the World Economic Forum in Davos. “They plan to make an announcement on a particular champion within the space to lead the Saudi efforts,” he said, declining to give further details.

Alswaha, who is chairman of the kingdom’s Space Agency as well, said the fund will also look to create a national space company to invest and acquire assets in that sector. The space industry is “ripe right now” for M&A, he said.

The fund, known as PIF, has emerged as one of the key parts of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s plan to shake up the Saudi economy and wean it off a reliance on oil sales. It has rapidly built up assets of around US$700 billion after a spending spree on everything from electric carmakers to backing upstart golf tournaments, and plans to control US$1 trillion by 2025.

Saudi Arabia to use Hong Kong as bridge to China’s tech prowess

One of its key initiatives has been to develop an auto manufacturing hub on the west coast of the kingdom. US EV maker Lucid Group is already assembling cars from the site, and is set to be joined by Hyundai Motor and Ceer, a brand created by the PIF. The plan involves developing downstream industries that is expected to also include making semiconductors and batteries.

The kingdom launched its space programme in 2018 and sent astronauts into space last year, as part of a wider plan to invest in the industry.

“The new space economy is definitely the next trillion-dollar opportunity,” Al-Swaha said. “The kingdom is very bullish on not only becoming a regional leader in this space but also a global leader. The ambition by 2030 is to definitely establish regional leadership and then move on by 2040 to global leadership.”

A key part of Saudi Arabia’s space investments will be in communications, Alswaha said. “2.6 billion people in 2024 are still not connected and the only way to connect the unconnected is from the skies.”

Alswaha said that Saudi Arabia expects to be able to continue to attract investment from both US and Chinese technologies companies, even as tensions between the world’s two largest economies escalate. The kingdom “has demonstrated our partnership with both east and west on protecting their intellectual property and patents and any potential technology leakage,” Alswaha said.

Saudi Arabia is “pro-investment, pro-partnership and open market,” he said. “Anybody that complies with our regulatory, security requirements, serves our national interest, we will work with.”

item.title: Huawei chases enterprise clients in South Korea as consumers hold onto Samsung, Apple smartphones
item.description:
English summary:

  • Huawei is seeking to return to the global smartphone market, but its business prospects in South Korea are limited due to intense competition from Samsung and Apple, as well as ongoing US sanctions.
  • Huawei's market share in Korea remains minimal due to the country's strong preference for Samsung and Apple smartphones and the lack of consumer trust in Chinese vendors.
  • Huawei is focusing on expanding its enterprise services and cloud computing business in Korea, targeting the information technology and entertainment industries.

Chinese summary:

  • 华为寻求重返全球智能手机市场，但由于三星和苹果的激烈竞争以及持续的美国制裁，其在韩国的业务前景有限。
  • 华为在韩国的市场份额仍然很小，这是由于韩国消费者强烈偏好三星和苹果智能手机，以及消费者对中国供应商缺乏信任。
  • 华为正集中精力在韩国拓展其企业服务和云计算业务，目标是信息技术和娱乐行业。

Words:

  • poised (adj.) - /poʊzd/ 准备好的，即将发生的

    原文例句：Chinese telecommunications equipment giant Huawei Technologies is poised to make a comeback in the global smartphone market this year.

    例句讲解：这个单词的意思是“准备好的，即将发生的”，表示华为准备今年再次进入全球智能手机市场。

  • double-digit (adj.) - /ˈdʌbəl ˈdɪdʒɪt/ 两位数的，两位数字的

    原文例句：Huawei is forecast to move into the spotlight in the smartphone industry in 2024, with projected double-digit growth in global shipments, according to a report published last week by research firm TechInsights.

    例句讲解：这个单词的意思是“两位数的，两位数字的”，表示华为在全球智能手机出货量预计将在2024年出现两位数的增长。

Phrases:

  • strong preference (n.) - 强烈偏好

    原文例句：Huawei's market share in Korea remains minimal due to the country's strong preference for Samsung and Apple smartphones and the lack of consumer trust in Chinese vendors.

    例句讲解：这个词组的意思是“强烈偏好”，表示韩国消费者强烈偏好三星和苹果智能手机。

Sentences:

  • Huawei is forecast to move into the spotlight in the smartphone industry in 2024, with projected double-digit growth in global shipments, according to a report published last week by research firm TechInsights. - 根据研究公司TechInsights上周发布的一份报告，预计华为将在2024年成为智能手机行业备受瞩目的焦点，预计全球出货量将实现两位数增长。

    句子分析：这个句子的结构是“主语+谓语+宾语+状语”，主语是Huawei，谓语是is forecast to move into the spotlight，宾语是double-digit growth in global shipments，状语是according to a report published last week by research firm TechInsights。这个句子向读者传达了华为将在2024年成为智能手机行业备受瞩目的焦点，并且预计全球出货量将实现两位数增长的信息。

Grammar:

  • Present perfect tense (时态) - 表示过去发生的动作或状态一直持续到现在。

    原文例句：Huawei is forecast to move into the spotlight in the smartphone industry in 2024, with projected double-digit growth in global shipments, according to a report published last week by research firm TechInsights.

    语法讲解：这个时态用来表示过去发生的动作或状态一直持续到现在，并在将来仍将继续。在句中，is forecast to move into the spotlight是现在完成时态，表示华为有望在2024年成为智能手机行业备受瞩目的焦点，这种状态从过去持续到现在，并且在将来仍将继续。

  • Reported speech (间接引语) - 用于转述别人说过的话。

    原文例句：Huawei is reportedly aiming to bring its handsets back to some overseas markets, including in Europe.

    语法讲解：这个结构用来转述别人说过的话，通常在句中使用reportedly、allegedly等词语来表示。reportedly是reported的副词形式，意为“据报道”，表示这句话是根据报道或消息来源转述的。在这个句子里，reportedly aiming to bring its handsets back to some overseas markets, including in Europe表示华为据报道正计划将自己的手机带回一些海外市场，包括欧洲。

  • Huawei is unlikely to gain ground in the South Korean smartphone market, which is dominated by Samsung and Apple, analysts say
  • The Chinese firm’s new cloud division in the country is eyeing business from the local tech and entertainment industries

This article was first published by The Korea Times in a partnership with the South China Morning Post.

Chinese telecommunications equipment giant Huawei Technologies is poised to make a comeback in the global smartphone market this year, but in South Korea, the company must contend with the lingering impact of US sanctions and intense competition with international and local rivals, according to industry watchers.

Huawei is forecast to move into the spotlight in the smartphone industry in 2024, with projected double-digit growth in global shipments, according to a report published last week by research firm TechInsights, which described the Chinese company as a potential “big surprise”.

But in Korea – home to smartphone and semiconductor titan Samsung Electronics – Huawei is struggling to expand its market share or secure trust from local partners amid the US-China tech rivalry, analysts said.

The Shenzhen-based company, which has been offering various products and services to Korean customers for two decades, has been effectively absent from the country’s smartphone market in the past few years due to its “inability to source 5G chipsets”, said Abhilash Kumar, an analyst at TechInsights.

“South Korea’s smartphone market is 5G-heavy, with a 5G penetration of more than 95 per cent for 2023, so it made little sense for consumers to buy Huawei’s 4G-powered phones,” he said.

Since 2019, Washington has barred the Chinese company, on national security grounds, from accessing US technologies including Google’s most popular apps, which are commonly pre-installed in Android phones sold by rivals like Samsung. That has dealt a heavy blow to Huawei’s overseas sales.

Huawei, which briefly surpassed Samsung to lead global smartphone shipments in early 2020, has dropped out of the global top five since 2021. Last year, the world’s five biggest smartphone vendors were Apple, Samsung, Xiaomi, Transsion and Vivo, according to a report published on Monday by research firm IDC.

In Korea, Huawei had a market share of just 0.1 per cent as of December, far lagging Samsung’s 68.7 per cent and Apple’s 26.5 per cent, numbers from online database Statcounter showed.

Huawei made a splash in its home market China last August with the surprise launch of the Mate 60 Pro handset equipped with an advanced, domestically-developed 5G chip. The company is reportedly aiming to bring its handsets back to some overseas markets, including in Europe.

Still, “it looks unlikely” that the firm would return to the Korean smartphone market, Kumar said.

“Now that Huawei might have managed to source 5G chipsets locally,” he said. “It’s still difficult for it because [South Korea] is Samsung- and Apple-heavy and doesn’t have much acceptance for Chinese vendors.”

Huawei has tried to launch both premium and affordable smartphones in Korea since 2014, but it has been unable to gain ground “largely due to local operators’ preference for Samsung,” said Woody Oh, service director at TechInsights. “To be successful in the Korean market, [manufacturers] must seek operators’ support.”

Amid difficulties in the consumer market, Huawei is pinning its hopes on enterprise services, according to Wang Balian, CEO of Huawei Korea.

The Huawei-supported 5G network used by Korean carriers ranked first in global tests last year, Wang said at a year-end event in Seoul last month. The company’s enterprise products include data centre networks, campus networks and storage services.

Wang said the company was also expanding its foothold in the cloud computing market, having established a cloud division in Korea last year in hope of serving the information technology and cultural entertainment industries.

The executive highlighted Huawei’s commitment to the Korean market despite running into controversies last year, when SK Hynix – the second-largest memory chip maker in Korea – announced it was investigating how its products ended up in the Mate 60 Pro.

Hynix said at the time that it “no longer does business with Huawei since the introduction of the US restrictions against the company”.

One of Huawei’s key business partners in Korea is LG Electronics. Wang called LG Uplus, South Korea’s third-largest mobile carrier and the country’s sole mobile network operator using Huawei’s 5G base stations, has been touted as one of the Chinese firm’s “important global clients”.

Looking to 2024, Wang said Huawei Korea, which has more than 230 employees, planned to help the country achieve its digitisation and carbon neutrality goals, while continuing to support the cultivation of 1,000 next-generation information technology professionals.

item.title: Should we let AI take over mundane work? Not so fast
item.description:
Summary：

The use of generative AI like ChatGPT may increase productivity, but it can also limit the supplementary learning that occurs when people do certain tasks. This is because generative AI generates content from a complex large-language model instead of logically developing it based on facts, leading to potential inaccuracies and misleading results. Outsourcing tasks to generative AI is similar to outsourcing them to other people, and studies have shown that this can lead to a decrease in productivity and learning, particularly for tasks that are closely related. Therefore, organizations and individuals should carefully consider the objectives of using generative AI and provide additional training to mitigate its potential negative effects on human capability and learning.
  • Abstract: Generative AI's impact on productivity and human capability.
  • Theme: The potential negative effects of generative AI on learning and human capability, particularly in the context of outsourcing tasks.
  • Viewpoint: The importance of considering both work output and learning when deploying generative AI, and the need for careful management and training to mitigate its negative effects.
  • Main information: Studies showing the decrease in productivity and learning when outsourcing tasks to generative AI; the need to distinguish between objectives (work output vs. learning) when deploying generative AI; the importance of classifying tasks by nature and providing additional training to mitigate negative effects; the danger of unrestrained use of generative AI in education.

总结：

使用像ChatGPT这样的生成式AI可能会提高生产力，但它也可能限制人们在执行某些任务时所获得的补充性学习。这是因为生成式人工智能从复杂的大语言模型生成内容，而不是在事实的基础上进行逻辑开发，导致潜在的不准确和误导性结果。将任务外包给生成式人工智能就如同将它们外包给其他人，研究表明，这可能导致生产力和学习的下降，特别是对于那些密切相关的任务。因此，组织和个人在使用生成式人工智能时应仔细考虑其目标，并提供额外的培训，以减轻其对人类能力和学习的潜在负面影响。
  • 摘要：生成式人工智能对生产力和人类能力的影响。
  • 主题：生成式人工智能对学习和人类能力的潜在负面影响，尤其是在外包任务的背景下。
  • 观点：在部署生成式人工智能时考虑工作产出和学习的重要性，以及仔细管理和培训以减轻其负面影响的必要性。
  • 主要信息：研究表明，将任务外包给生成式人工智能时生产力和学习力下降；在部署生成式人工智能时需要区分目标（工作产出与学习）；任务分类的必要性以及提供额外培训以减轻负面影响；在教育中不加节制地使用生成式人工智能的危险性。

单词：

  • supplement (v.) - /ˈsʌplɪmɛnt/ 补充，使完整。

    原文例句：However, it might actually limit the supplementary learning that occurs when people do certain tasks, so AI must be deployed with care.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于拉丁语，由sub-（在……下面）和plere（填充）组成，意思是“使完整，弥补”。在这个例句中，它指的是生成式人工智能可能会限制人们在执行某些任务时所获得的补充性学习。

  • acknowledge (v.) - /ækˈnɑːlɪdʒ/ 承认，认识到。

    原文例句：This case raises an important question: how does generative AI affect human capability when people no longer need to develop logical arguments and verify facts when creating content?

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于古法语单词“a con essayer”，意思是“同意”。在这个例句中，它指的是生成式人工智能会对人类能力产生什么影响，因为人们在创建内容时不再需要发展逻辑论证和核实事实。

词组：

  • in terms of - 就……而言，从……方面来说。

    原文例句：We looked at many reasons for the drop in productivity, including a loss of motivation due to not being rewarded in the IBB program.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由in（在……里面），terms（条件，条款）和of（属于，关于）构成的，表示“按照某种标准或角度来衡量或评价”。在这个例句中，它表示我们从很多方面研究了生产力下降的原因，包括由于没有在IBB计划中获得奖励而导致的动力丧失。

句子：

  • This inter-task learning side-effect is illuminating. - 这种跨任务的学习副作用具有启发性。
